Welcome to Voltage Data’s documentation!¶

This package is based on the Python scientific ecosystem allowing to handle a series of time and voltage measures; it’s in fact suitable for every kind of measures involving two variables, one of which may come with uncertainties.

Guide¶

class main.VoltageData(times, voltages, voltage_errors=None)¶

Class for handling voltage-time data.

times¶

Array of time values.

Type

array of float64

voltages¶

Array of voltage values.

Type

array of float64

voltage_errors¶

Array of voltage uncertainties, defaults to None.

Type

array of float64, optional

classmethod from_file(file_path)¶

Classmethod for reading values from a .txt file. Time and voltage values mustn’t be blank. If a value in a row isn’t a float all the values in the same row won’t be red.

file_path¶

Path of the source file.

Type

str

Returns

t, v – Values that initialize the class.

Return type

lists of float

num_columns()¶

Number of columns (can be 2 or 3).

num_rows()¶

Number of rows.

plot(ax=None, fmt='bo', **plot_options)¶

Draws the data points using matplotlib.pyplot.

ax¶

Existing figure to add to the plot, defaults to None.

Type

obj, optional

fmt¶

Color, marker, linestyle formatter, defaluts to ‘bo’.

Type

str, optional

plot_options¶
Type

str, optional

Returns

ax – Figure object.

Return type

obj

spline()¶

Returns the spline of the data points, only if len(self)>3 (the degree of the spline).

property timestamps¶

Returns times.

property voltage_errs¶

Return the voltage errors as a numpy array.

property voltages¶

Returns voltages.
